body.section: How does differ from a pure OpenStack cloud implementation?There are a number of enhancements in that are not available natively with a pure OpenStack implementation. The enhacements begin at installation time and take the cloud operator through integration, operations, and maintenance, and help secure your cloud on a number of fronts.

During installation of , for exampe, the core OpenStack services, such as compute, networking, orchestration, storage, and identity are installed automatically, and by default. These services are integrated and work together out of the box. Rather than configuring each service individually and configuring their interaction, the lifecycle manager, a collection of Ansible playbooks, script together those integrations. The playbooks read YAML files that describe your cloud confguration in human-readable text which you have entered or edited, and builds your cloud based on those configuration settings. In addition, these files, collectively referred to as the HPE Helion OpenStack input model are pre-populated as a starting point for a variety of cloud configurations.

lifecyle manager responsibilities go beyond installation and configuration, however. Ongoing management, in many instances can be achieved using the lifecycle manager rather than the OpenStack APIs as the Ansible playbooks themselves use the OpenStack APIs and abstract the tasks for you.

Additionally, the following security features are built into :
Data at rest encryption capabilities including encrypted storage of passwords and sensitive data
Reduction of surface vulnerabilities based on extensive years of experience running OpenStack in the HPE Public Cloud
Centralized log management capabilities
Integration with HPE ArcSight.
Security rules that close all unused ports
AppArmor to provide an additional layer of automated protection against VM breakouts
Role-based access control to control who and what can access services and resources
Auditing of inter-service activities
Barbican Key Management Finally some of the management features include
Active health monitoring of the end-to-end cloud infrastructure
Centralized logging all alerts and alarms for event correlation to root- cause analysis
Telemetry / usage metering and internal usage reporting capabilities for showback/chargeback/and billing systems
Identity management of Active Directory and other LDAP providers
